node_1.locution: Howard : A lot of these areas were designated - this is not just green belt, this is areas of outstanding natural beauty and the national parks - were designated, or at least the process for setting their designation came apart shortly after the Second World War, when there was a real re-evaluation of what actually was important, and how we were actually going to look after those areas that we consider to be important in the nation's interest, not just for local interest
